TopicTitle: How do you record KSP using OBS?

Articles.Content:
I've tried and tried again, but it doesn't seem to work.

Simply put it, I record KSP, but when I cannot open it with Windows Movie Maker due to the files being .flv, which WMM (win movie maker) cannot use.

What do I do, and what do I use?
You can go into the settings for OBS and change it to output to .mp4 instead. You can then import these files into Movie Maker or just about any other video editor.
I remember trying to record the game with OBS once. It was always getting stuck on the first frame. Never figured what was the problem.

Thanks Guys! It worked (despite no sound and somewhat grainy quality...)

Oh well, maybe this page should be left open as a reference to those needing help with recording KSP videos.
Not sure if this will help you, but Windows 10 has an in built video recording thingy.  Though you do need a fairly modern graphics card for it to work.

For the record, Movie Maker is easy to use, but it pales in comparison to other FREE OPEN SOURCE video editors out there.
but if you wish to stick to Movie Maker, you can also find a free video converter to encode from FLV to MP4
